intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. multinerve, commonly known as the multivened bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive venation pattern, giving it the variety name *multinerve*. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
